bibl.title: Letter from Frederick V. Coville to Howard A. Kelly, February 17, 1908

div1.p: Coville asks Kelly to write an obituary of Carroll for the Washington Academy of Sciences.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick V. Coville to Howard A. Kelly, February 17, 1908
div1.opener:
M
DR L
UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE,
BUREAU OF PLANT INDUSTRY.
Washington, D. C., February 17, 1908.
TAXONOMIC INVESTIGATIONS.
Dr. Howard A. Kelly,
Johns Hopkins University,
Baltimore, Md.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
It has been the custom of the Washington Academy of Sciences
to publish biographical notices of deceased members. At the sug-
gestion of Dr. A. F. A. King I am writing to ascertain whether you
will not undertake to prepare a notice of Dr. James J. Carroll. I
send to you by mail today a copy of the biographical sketches pub-
lished in Volume V of the Proceedings of the Academy. It is desired
that the notices should not exceed a thousand or at most fifteen hun-
dred words and should be in my hands by the tenth of March. As the
representative of the Academy, I shall much appreciate your courtesy
if you will undertake to prepare this notice.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Frederick V. Coville,
Chairman.
